Running on Android 2.1 (Eclair), this device is powered by a Qualcomm MSM7227 Snapdragon S1 chipset with a 600 MHz ARM 11 CPU and Adreno 200 GPU. It features a 3.5-inch TFT display with a resolution of 320 x 480 pixels and a 3.15-megapixel autofocus camera that can capture videos in 480p at 24 frames per second. The A50 also includes a dedicated microSDHC card slot for expandable storage, as well as 256 MB of RAM. Connectivity options include Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, GPS, and A-GPS, as well as a Garmin navigation system. The device is equipped with a 1150 mAh removable Li-Ion battery that provides up to 5 hours of talk time and up to 150 hours of standby time. The A50 comes in a black color and measures 116 x 62.2 x 12 mm, weighing 136 grams. Overall, the Garmin-Asus nuvifone A50 is a versatile and feature-packed smartphone that combines the best of both worlds.

Powered by the MediaTek MT6833P Dimensity 6080 chipset, this smartphone runs on Android 13 and features an octa-core processor with a clock speed of up to 2.4 GHz. The device comes with 4GB or 8GB of RAM and 128GB of internal storage, which can be expanded via a dedicated microSDXC card slot. The Note 30 5G's triple rear camera setup includes a 108-megapixel primary sensor, a 2-megapixel depth sensor, and a QVGA sensor. The front-facing camera is a 16-megapixel sensor with a dual-LED flash. The device is equipped with a 5000mAh battery that supports 45W wired charging. Connectivity options include Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, GPS, NFC, FM radio, and USB Type-C. The Note 30 5G is available in Magic Black, Interstellar Blue, and Sunset Gold color options, and is priced at INR 12,999 for the 4GB RAM variant.

generated.out: The Asus ROG Phone 6 Diablo Immortal Edition boasts a 6.78-inch AMOLED display with a 165Hz refresh rate and HDR10+ support, powered by the Qualcomm Snapdragon 8+ Gen 1 chipset. It comes with 16GB of RAM and 512GB of internal storage, expandable via USB Type-C. The triple rear camera setup includes a 50MP main sensor, a 13MP ultra-wide sensor, and a 5MP macro sensor, while the front-facing camera is a 12MP shooter. The device is equipped with a 6000mAh battery that supports 65W wired charging and 10W reverse wired charging. Connectivity options include Wi-Fi 802.11 a/b/g/n/ac/6e, Bluetooth 5.2, GPS, GLONASS, BDS, GALILEO, QZSS, NavIC, NFC, and USB Type-C. The device runs on Android 12 and features an under-display optical fingerprint sensor, accelerometer, gyro, proximity, and compass sensors. The ROG Phone 6 Diablo Immortal Edition is available in Hellfire Red and is priced at €920.96 or $666.66.

The phone comes with a 3.15-megapixel primary camera with LED flash, as well as a VGA front-facing camera for selfies. The device is equipped with a removable Li-Ion 880 mAh battery, which offers up to 5 hours of talk time on 2G and 4 hours on 3G networks. The Sagem Puma Phone also includes a range of features, such as accelerometer and compass sensors, GPS and A-GPS positioning, and a stereo FM radio with RDS. The PH1 is available in Gray, Blue, and Red color options, and is priced around 70 EUR.

generated.out: The Nvidia Shield is a portable entertainment device that boasts a 8.0-inch IPS LCD display with a resolution of 1920 x 1200 pixels. It runs on Android 4.4.2 (KitKat) and is powered by Nvidia's Tegra K1 chipset, featuring a quad-core 2.2 GHz Cortex-A15 CPU and a ULP GeForce Kepler GPU with 192 cores. The device comes with 2GB of RAM and 16GB of internal storage, expandable via a dedicated microSDXC card slot. The rear camera is a 5MP autofocus unit with HDR capabilities, while the front-facing camera is also 5MP. The Shield is equipped with stereo speakers, a 3.5mm headphone jack, and a dual bass reflex port. Connectivity options include Wi-Fi 802.11 a/b/g/n (dual-band), Bluetooth 4.0, A2DP, and LE. The device is GPS-enabled but does not support NFC or cellular connectivity. The Shield is available in black and is priced around €230 (approximately $270).

generated.out: The Doogee S41 Pro boasts a sleek design with a 5.5-inch IPS LCD display and a resolution of 720 x 1440 pixels. It runs on Android 12 and is powered by the Mediatek MT6761V/WAB Helio A22 chipset with a quad-core 2.0 GHz Cortex-A53 CPU and PowerVR GE8320 GPU. The device comes with 4GB RAM and 64GB internal storage, expandable via a microSDXC card. The triple rear camera setup includes a 13MP main sensor with PDAF, while the front-facing camera is an 8MP shooter. The S41 Pro offers a variety of connectivity options, including Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, GPS, GLONASS, GALILEO, BDS, NFC (region/market dependent), FM radio, and USB Type-C 2.0 with OTG. The device is equipped with an accelerometer and proximity sensor, and its 6300mAh battery is non-removable and Li-Po. The S41 Pro is available in black, orange, and green color options and is both IP68/IP69K dust and water-resistant, as well as drop-to-concrete resistant from up to 1.8m.

This smartphone is powered by a Mediatek MT6753 chipset, an octa-core 1.3 GHz Cortex-A53 CPU, and a Mali-T760MP2 GPU. It runs on Android 5.1 (Lollipop) and comes in three variants with either 32GB or 64GB of internal storage and 3GB of RAM. The primary camera is a 13MP shooter with an aperture of f/2.4, autofocus, and LED flash, while the front-facing camera is an 8MP sensor with an f/2.2 aperture. Connectivity options include Wi-Fi, Bluetooth 4.1, GPS, and a microUSB 2.0 port with OTG support. The device is fueled by a 6000mAh non-removable battery with a 10W charging speed. The Posh Volt Max LTE L640 supports 2G, 3G, and 4G networks on both SIM slots, with speeds of up to 150/50 Mbps on LTE Cat4. The smartphone is available in Grey, Gold, and Rose Gold color options.

The device is available in Stellar Green and Nebula Purple color options, and is priced at ₹12,999.

The device is equipped with a 4000mAh battery with Quick Charge 4.0 support. Connectivity options include Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, GPS, GLONASS, GALILEO, NFC, and USB Type-C 3.1. The LG K92 5G is available in Titan Gray and is priced around €340.

generated.out: Introducing the Wind Van Gogh 2100, a mobile phone that combines style and functionality. This GSM device operates on 900/1800/1900 MHz bands and supports Class 10 GPRS connectivity, but does not have EDGE capability. The phone was announced in October 2007, but unfortunately, it was canceled. The Wind Van Gogh 2100 features a compact body measuring 98 x 47.5 x 16.3 mm and weighing 75 grams, with a Mini-SIM card slot. The 1.8-inch TFT display has a resolution of 176 x 220 pixels and supports downloadable wallpapers and screensavers. The phone has a 2-megapixel camera, but does not support video recording. It also includes a vibration alert, downloadable polyphonic, MIDI, and MP3 ringtones, but lacks a 3.5mm headphone jack. The Wind Van Gogh 2100 supports WLAN, Bluetooth 1.2 with A2DP, FM radio, and USB 1.1 connectivity. It comes with messaging, email, web browsing, and gaming capabilities, as well as Java support. The phone is powered by a removable Li-Ion 820 mAh battery, which provides up to 150 hours of standby time and 3 hours of talk time. The Wind Van Gogh 2100 is available in silver-gray and silver-fuchsia colors.

Powered by the Nvidia Tegra 2 T20 chipset and a dual-core 1.0 GHz Cortex-A9 CPU, this device runs on Android 2.2 (Froyo) and can be upgraded to Android 2.3 (Gingerbread). It comes with 16GB of internal storage, expandable via a microSDHC card, and features a 5-megapixel autofocus camera with LED flash and 720p video capabilities. The tablet also has a 1.3-megapixel front-facing camera for video calls. Connectivity options include Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, GPS, and USB 2.0. The device is equipped with an accelerometer, proximity, and compass sensors, and includes HTML, Adobe Flash, MP4/H.264/WMV player, MP3/WAV/eAAC+/WMA player, QuickOffice document viewer, photo viewer/editor, and organizer features. The Dell Streak 7 Wi-Fi is powered by a non-removable Li-Ion 2780 mAh battery with a standby time of up to 72 hours and a talk time of up to 4 hours. The tablet is available in gray and was priced at approximately €140 when it was released in April 2011.

Running on an Android-based operating system, this smartphone features a 3.2-inch TFT display with a resolution of 320 x 480 pixels and a 3:2 ratio, providing a clear and vibrant viewing experience. The device is powered by an 806 MHz Marvell PXA 920 CPU and comes with 150MB of internal storage, expandable via a dedicated microSDHC card slot. The WT18i supports 2G and 3G connectivity, including TD-SCDMA, and offers HSPA speeds of up to 2.8/2 Mbps. The dual-camera setup on the back consists of a 48MP wide-angle lens and a 48MP ultra-wide-angle lens, while the front-facing camera is a 25MP shooter. The Fairphone 4 supports 4G LTE, 5G, and Wi-Fi connectivity, and features a 3905mAh removable battery that can be charged at 20W. The device is available in gray, green, or speckled green, and comes with a standard 5-year warranty. The Fairphone 4 is IP54 rated for dust and splash resistance and meets MIL-STD-810G compliance standards.

generated.out: The iPhone 15 Plus boasts a 6.7-inch Super Retina XDR OLED display with a resolution of 1290 x 2796 pixels and a 19.5:9 aspect ratio. It is powered by the Apple A16 Bionic chipset, which features a hexacore processor and a 5-core graphics unit. The device comes with 6GB of RAM and offers 128GB, 256GB, or 512GB of internal storage, all of which utilize NVMe technology. The dual-camera setup on the back consists of a 48MP wide-angle lens with sensor-shift optical image stabilization and a 12MP ultra-wide-angle lens. The front-facing camera is a 12MP sensor with SL 3D technology for depth and biometric sensing. The device supports 5G, Wi-Fi 6, Bluetooth 5.3, and Ultra Wideband 2 (UWB) technology. The iPhone 15 Plus is equipped with a 4383mAh Li-Ion battery that can be charged via wired or wireless means, including MagSafe and Qi standards. The device is available in black, blue, green, yellow, or pink and features Face ID, accelerometer, gyro, proximity, and compass sensors, as well as a barometer. The iPhone 15 Plus has received a 1385649 score on AnTuTu, a 6618 score on GeekBench, and a 60fps score on the ES 3.1 benchmark for graphics performance. The device's display has an infinite contrast ratio, and the loudspeaker has a -27.7 LUFS rating for audio performance. The iPhone 15 Plus has an active use score of 16:33 hours and an endurance rating of 111 hours for battery life.

The my721z is equipped with a removable Li-Ion battery with a capacity of 1000mAh, providing up to 3 hours of talk time and up to 200 hours of standby time. The phone's dimensions are 106 x 52 x 12 mm, and it weighs 125 grams. It comes in a silver color and includes features such as a stereo FM radio, WAP 2.0/xHTML browser, and a music player. The my721z also supports predictive text input, messaging, and organizer functions.

The device comes with 32GB or 64GB of internal storage, expandable via microSDXC card, and 3GB or 4GB of RAM. The rear camera packs a 12-megapixel sensor with PDAF, while the front camera has an 8-megapixel sensor. The KeyOne is equipped with a 3500mAh non-removable battery that supports fast charging, providing up to 36 minutes of charging time for a 50% battery level. Other features include a physical QWERTY keyboard, dual-SIM support, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, GPS, NFC, FM radio, USB Type-C, and a 3.5mm headphone jack. The device is available in black, silver, or bronze and retails for approximately €290.

With a 5.96-inch AMOLED display and a resolution of 1440 x 2560 pixels, this Windows 10-powered device boasts a 72.2% screen-to-body ratio. It is powered by a Qualcomm Snapdragon 820 processor and comes with 4GB of RAM, ensuring smooth multitasking and fast performance. The Elite x3 features a 16-megapixel rear camera and an 8-megapixel front camera, both with LED flash and HDR capabilities. The device is IP67 dust and water resistant and meets military-grade durability standards. It supports dual SIM cards and has a microSDXC card slot for expandable storage. The Elite x3's 4150mAh battery can be charged via USB Type-C or wirelessly using Qi or PMA technology. The device is available in gold or graphite/chrome finishes and retails for approximately €700.

generated.out: Introducing the Oukitel RT6, a versatile device that boasts an impressive set of features. With a 10.1-inch IPS LCD display and a resolution of 1200 x 1920 pixels, this tablet offers stunning visuals. The RT6 is powered by the Mediatek MT8788 chipset and comes with 8GB of RAM, ensuring smooth and fast performance. The tablet runs on Android 13 and features a 16MP rear camera and a 16MP front camera, both with LED flash. The RT6 is equipped with a massive 20000mAh battery that supports 33W wired charging and reverse wired charging. This tablet is also incredibly durable, with IP68/IP69K dust and water resistance, drop-to-concrete resistance from up to 1.5m, and MIL-STD-810H compliance. The RT6 supports a wide range of connectivity options, including 5G, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, GPS, GLONASS, GALILEO, BDS, and NFC (although NFC is not included). The tablet is available in black or orange and is priced at around 350 EUR.

The device comes with 3GB of RAM and 32GB or 64GB of internal storage, which cannot be expanded via a card slot. The Le 2 features a 16-megapixel rear camera with PDAF and a 8-megapixel front-facing camera, both with their own set of features. The smartphone is equipped with a 3000mAh non-removable battery that supports fast charging at 18W. Connectivity options include dual-SIM support, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, GPS, GLONASS, BDS, NFC (absent), an infrared port, and a USB Type-C port. The Le 2 is available in various colors, including rose gold, gold, silver, and grey, and was released in April 2016. The price of the device is approximately €190.

The device features a 4.5-inch IPS LCD display with a resolution of 540 x 960 pixels and a 5-megapixel rear camera with LED flash, HDR, and panorama capabilities. It also has a 2-megapixel front-facing camera and a 2000mAh removable Li-Ion battery. Connectivity options include Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, GPS, and microUSB 2.0, while sensors include an accelerometer, proximity, and compass. The Hydro Life comes in a black color and measures 131.8 x 65.4 x 10.9mm, weighing 136g.

The U680S supports dual SIM cards (Micro-SIM/Nano-SIM, dual stand-by) and is available in Green and Black color options. It was announced in June 2021 and released in Q3 of the same year. The price of the Energizer U680S is approximately €120.

The phone does not have a camera, but it does have loudspeaker and monophonic ringtones. Connectivity options are limited, with no support for WLAN, Bluetooth, or USB. The A2628 does have messaging capabilities, including SMS, and it also includes a clock, alarm, calculator, and stopwatch. The battery is removable and comes in two capacities, with a high capacity battery option available. The phone is available in four colors: Astral Blue, Pistachio Yellow, Green Pepper, and Celestial black.

It features a 5.0-inch IPS LCD display with a resolution of 480 x 854 pixels, resulting in a screen-to-body ratio of approximately 61.2%. The device runs on Android 4.4.2 (KitKat) and is powered by a dual-core 1.3 GHz Cortex-A7 processor with a Mali-400 GPU. It comes with 4GB of internal storage and 512MB of RAM, which can be expanded via a microSDHC card. The primary camera is an 8-megapixel autofocus lens with LED flash and panorama capabilities, while the secondary camera is a 2-megapixel lens. Connectivity options include Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, GPS, FM radio, and microUSB 2.0. The device is equipped with an accelerometer and proximity sensor, and is fueled by a 2000mAh Li-Ion battery that provides up to 5 hours of talk time and up to 30 hours of music playback. The Spice Smart Flo 508 (Mi-508) is available in blue and meets the SAR EU limit of 0.82 W/kg for head exposure.

generated.out: The VK Mobile VK300 is a feature phone that was released in July 2005 and has since been discontinued. It operates on GSM networks and supports 2G bands GSM 900/1800 with GPRS connectivity. The phone measures 79.5 x 42.5 x 21.5 mm and weighs 75 grams, with a Mini-SIM card slot. The VK300 features a 1.8-inch TFT display with a resolution of 128 x 160 pixels and a secondary STN display with a resolution of 80 x 80 pixels. It does not have a built-in camera, but it does support messaging via SMS, EMS, and MMS, as well as WAP 1.2.1 browsing and organizer features. The phone is powered by a removable Li-Ion 720 mAh battery, which provides up to 125 hours of standby time and up to 3 hours of talk time. The VK300 is available in silver-black and gold color options.
